intro: Laumoniera, commonly known as the golden groundsel, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows and woodland edges, thriving in well-drained soil. Its yellow flowers bloom in the spring, and it produces small, oval-shaped seeds that are dispersed by the wind. Laumoniera is often used in ornamental gardening due to its bright color and ease of cultivation.
